channel.title: Maths on Tim Holzschuh
channel.description: Recent content in Maths on Tim Holzschuh

item.title: Galois Cohomology I
item.description: During the winter term in 2022, I’m TAing the course Galois Cohomology I by Prof. Alexander Schmidt. The exercise sheets will be accessible through the relevant Mampf course on Wednesdays, and will be discussed in the exercise session of the subsequent week: When? Wednesday, 2:00 pm Where? SR3 First session: 26.10. Contact: tholzschuh@mathi.uni-heidelberg.de You won’t have to hand in written solutions to the exercises, but I strongly encourage you to spend a fair amount of time thinking about them in order to get the most out of the exercise sessions.

item.title: The Grothendieck conjecture for affine curves
item.description: Together with Jakob Stix I’m organizing a GAUS-AG on Tamagawa’s seminal paper The Grothendieck conjecture for affine curves. A detailed programme can be found here. When? Roughly every two weeks on Wednesday. Where? We’re rotating between Heidelberg and Frankfurt. Check out the programme for specific dates and places. Contact: tholzschuh[at]mathi.uni-heidelberg.de stix[at]math.uni-frankfurt.de

item.title: Galois and Fundamental Groups
item.description: Together with Marius Leonhardt I’m supervising a seminar on Galois and fundamental groups. The announcement (in german) is here. If you’re interested, subscribe via MÃœSLI or send us an email. When? Thursdays, 02:15pm - 03:45pm Where? Mathematikon, SR 6 (Group A) and SR 7 (Group B) Contact: tholzschuh[at]mathi.uni-heidelberg.de mleonhardt[at]mathi.uni-heidelberg.de Handouts of all the talks can be found MaMpf.
